revised_title: A New Method for Measuring Small Electrostatic Capacities Using an Air Leyden
tldr: The author presents a new form of air Leyden jar that can be used to measure small electrostatic capacities, such as those of short lengths of cable. The instrument consists of two mutually insulated metallic pieces, which are composed of parallel plates. The author explains its use in conjunction with an idiostatic electrometer for the direct measurement of the capacity of insulated conductors.
